data.title: Not good
data.text: I was in a couple of times and both times they were very inefficient and nor really nice. My drink was not made as ordered either time. Also, the store was not very clean.

data.title: One of my places....
data.text: The STARBUCKS on Century Drive is a daily stop for me on my way to work.  The staff here call their customers by name (sort of like on "Cheers"), the service is speedy, and the drinks are excellent.  Lately I am a fan of the Chicken/Artichoke Panini and the new Strawberry Lemon/Limeade Granitas.  Stopping here takes a few of my dollars but gives me, in return, a friendly place to begin the day. That, my friends, is a bargain!

data.title: Great location and decor
data.text: Brittany and her staff do a great job of keeping things neat and serving up the best java.  This store was re-done a few years ago and is very much "Bend".  The location, tables by the window and outside, and the environment in the store could not be better.

data.title: Not your average Starbucks
data.text: We are a Starbucks family but for some reason, this Starbucks is our favorite. It is situated in downtown Bend and is easy to get to if you are window shopping. There is a great ambience and the staff is always friendly. I tried the egg nog latte, wow but I will have to work off the calories on the slopes.

data.title: my 2nd favorite Starbucks in Bend
data.text: consistently good, conveniently located right downtown, carry a lot of the limited coffees, YUM YUM YUM

data.title: starbucks
data.text: well if you have to have it then this is a good place to get your fix. nice place to have a cup of joe and watch people go by.

data.title: So So Starbucks
data.text: Only so so for Starbucks. The restrooms were not stocked and filthy.  The drinks were only ok. Slow at best. And, they were out of syrups too. Not able to get my usual drink.

data.title: A Nice Place
data.text: This Starbacks is a nice, quiet (usually), clean and friendly place. It's great to sit and have conversations without having to raise your voice. The staff are always doing their best and their best is awesome.

data.title: Love this Starbucks
data.text: Next time you are downtown Bend stop in!  The staff at this location are gracious and kind - great representatives of Bend!  As always, the drinks were perfect and the ambiance very cozy and quaint.  Will be a regular each time I can be!

data.title: Same as other Starbucks
data.text: All Starbucks are the same and this one was the same as all I have ever been to. Polite and fast service. Nothing to make this stand out but if you need your Starbucks fix this is the place for you.

data.title: "MY" STARBUCKS!
data.text: This is actually a review of the Westside Starbucks, on Century Drive in Bend, OR.  This Starbucks is one of "my places".  It is where I stop nearly every morning on my way to work. I buy breakfast and lunch as well as a couple of snacks for the day.  Coffee, too.  The best part of "My Starbucks?" The STAFF!!  Do you remember the iconic TV program, "CHEERS"?  "Where everyone knows your name?" It's like that at this Starbucks....most of the staff not only know my name...they know what I want to order before I even open my mouth.nThe staff are responsive, friendly, quick, eager to please, and skilled at their barista tasks.  Bethany, Levi, Jonathan, Esther, Ryan, Wes, Amber...good people all.  Whether a Raspberry and Lemon Greek Yogurt and Granola parfait or a Pike Place Dark Roast coffee, I do love "my Starbucks"!

data.title: Was so glad to find a Starbucks in walking distance to hotel
data.text: After a nice walk in the brisk morning, I was able to get a nice cup of hot coffee and some yogurt.  Friendly staff and a clean location.  Almost missed it because an over grown tree outside blocked the sign.  But with Waze, took us right to it.

data.title: From a former Starbucks "hater," I am now a Starbucks "lover"
data.text: The one thing our local coffee shops lack is consistency.  With Starbucks, I always know what I am going to get.  I ask, and I receive.  In addition, they make it easy for me to hold business meetings at their locations.  Maybe I am lame for not patronizing our local spots time and time again, but at least I am rewarding consistency in product and service.

data.title: Coffee
data.text: While in Bend, I stopped in every morning at the local grocery store to buy a coffee and a marionberry muffin!! Great way to start the day!!

data.title: Excellent!
data.text: One of my favorite places to frequent!  Very friendly staff, delicious bakery items, great drinks - especially the new Very Berry Hibiscus Refresher!

data.title: Average cup of joe
data.text: Visited this place once while in bend.  The Americano was weak and the breakfast sandwich was so so.  It's Starbucks mind you so if you like fancy lattes, etc this is the place to go. If you want to experience coffee by itself then look elsewhere.

data.title: why go here when there are so many better local coffee houses?
data.text: why go here when there are so many better local coffee houses?
